attributes.action: Petition for those objecting to losing a major part of green belt in St Helens.
attributes.additional_details: To view the proposal of the plans visit https://www.sthelens.gov.uk/media/5099/technical-appendix-a-site-appraisals.pdf
attributes.background: There are proposed plans for Rainford-Village and its surrounding boroughs including St-Helens to lose the majority of the little remaining green belt to the development of houses. Most worrying to us is the effect on our environment, wildlife & the future impact of these plans.

rejection.details:
Local planning decisions are the responsibility of your local council, not the UK Government or Parliament. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are and how to contact them:
 
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
 
Once an application is made for development to take place, all local residents have the right to request that a planning application be ‘called in’ by the Department for Communities and Local Government. This means that it will assess the planning application against certain criteria and decide if a full inquiry is needed. For more information, including the criteria and how to request the call in of a planning application, see:
 
http://researchbriefings.files.parliament.uk/documents/SN00930/SN00930.pdf
